DataElement.preferredDefinition: A non-invasive scoring system based on several laboratory tests that help to estimate the amount of scarring in the liver and identify patients whose NAFLD has advanced to liver fibrosis. The scoring uses selected laboratory values (serum glucose, platelet count, albumin, AST/ALT ratio) and readily available patient characteristics (age, BMI, and diabetes status).
